pr_title: Modified searchAndReduce() to return empty agg when no docs exist

timeline.message:
Fix searchAndReduce() returning null for no docs

If no documents exist searchAndReduce() will
return an empty aggregation result
Cleaned up testCase() methods in agg tests

timeline.bodyText: This should do all the work for returning an empty aggregation. I am not 100% sure pre-pos-Collection is needed. Feedback is very welcome.
timeline.author: csoulios

replies.bodyText: What about just calling aggregator.buildEmptyAggregation? I think this one shouldn't need the pre and post stuff. Probably.
replies.author: nik9000

replies.bodyText: aggregator.buildEmptyAggregation() seems to be working fine. thanks!
replies.author: csoulios

timeline.author: nik9000
nik9000

replies.bodyText:
The < bits are ugly but required, otherwise compile fails. Hence I suggested this:
#55826 (comment)
replies.author: csoulios

replies.bodyText: I see what is up. I wonder if it'd be cleaner to return V instead of take a Consumer<V>. You'd get the implicit cast from assigning it to the result type you wanted. I wonder if that could save us a little ceremony?
replies.author: nik9000

replies.bodyText:
For every agg test I have created a local private method named testAggregation(). This method converts generic arguments to specific arguments and calls AggregateTestCase.testCase(). I think this is a lot cleaner and simpler.
Please check commit 23917bd and let me know what you think.
replies.author: csoulios

timeline.bodyText: Maybe rename these so they don't "hide" the superclass method and require the casts?
timeline.author: nik9000

timeline.bodyText:
Creating a method with specific (and not generic) arguments is a shortcut that saves us from writing
   this.<CardinalityAggregationBuilder, InternalCardinality>testCase(.....)

at every test case. This method simply passes the arguments to the generic AggregatorTestCase.testCase() method. I don't have a strong opinion about which option is best and I am happy go with any of the two methods.
timeline.author: csoulios

timeline.message: Refactored code to address reviewer's comments
